result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Set at $1,079.68 to be paid to Dijana B.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(40(b). Any remaining balance upon release to Extended Supervision shall be paid in full by the end of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during course of Extended supervision. Any remaining balance due at the end of Extended Sueprvision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 430 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol.  No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
No contact with known drug users.
No contact with any palces where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with family of Dragana B.

Notify DOC agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription  from any doctor.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent. Notify the DOC agent of the pharmacy used.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treament including drug and alcohol testing.  Must attend at least one alcohol and drug assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
*ES conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the   Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 430 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Kuzniewski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (53 pages) commencing MAY 12, 2015 received and filed.
Restitution Worksheet received and filed. tk

Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  

BRANCH 17 FOR BRANCH 3.
  Sworn as interpreter: Janet George. 

PSI reviewed by parties. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State as to sentencing.  Side bar placed on the record. Additional statements by: Dijana B and Tiaza B. Statements by the defense and defendant.   Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS concurrent with 2 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 430 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, concurrent with 1 and consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 430 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
- Drug and alcohol testing should be done  at least one time per month. 
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group per week.
 -Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Maintain Full Time employment. 
- No contact with known drug users.
- No contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
- No contact with the family of Dragana B. 
- Restitution set at $1079.68 paid to Dijana B. To be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be paid in full by the end of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of extended supervision. Any remaining balance due at the end of extended supervision will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 646
cf

Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for oral ruling.  Defendant desires to enter a plea, and does not want a oral ruling.  Court finds state has complied with victim notification, as to the plea.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/12/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders PSI for sentencing.  PSI order, signed and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Copy of transcript forwarded to Atty. Stephen Andrew Sargent, 819 North 6th Street, 9th Floor, Milwaukee, WI, 53203-1606.

Case adjourned for final pretrial and oral ruling on 2/18/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court orders all final pretrial documents filed by the next court date.  aw

  Motion hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for motion hearing.  Defense counsel informs the court that his client desires for him to withdraw as counsel.  Court held colloquy with defendant.  Court finds there is no basis to allow attorney Sargent to withdraw.  Mr. Kuzniewski to talk with Attorney Sargent.  
Discussions on the record were made about defendant giving up his right to have a hearing made.  Court held colloquy.   Defendant now wishes to have a hearing.  Defense to sit down and talk and show the defendant the CD's again to pinpoint what should be the focus be on them.  Parties to decide what part of the CD's should be listened to before the hearing.  Case adjourned for final pretrial and motion hearing on 11/18/2014 at 10:00 am, and jury trial on 12/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Matthew J Kuzniewski in custody.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol. Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bovan Family (relatives of Dragana B)
